name: Survey of Philosophy Quiz | Humanities | 10 Questions

questions.text: 'The unexamined life is not worth living'. Who is credited with saying this?
questions.explanation:
Socrates.

	Interesting idea. In Plato's writings he attributed this line to Socrates.

questions.text: 'The Fountainhead' and 'Atlas Shrugged' are examples of what philosophy?
The philosophy that praises something which provides 'the greatest good for the greatest number of people' is known by what name?
The concept of 'divide and rule' was popularized by ...?
The 'categorical imperative' is most closely associated with which philosopher?
The only 'true law' requires an individual to use 'right reason' so that he is in harmony with nature. To whom does this relate?
The branch of philosophy which deals with questions and issues of knowledge is known by what name?
Speaking of knowledge, who said: 'I think, therefore I exist'?
questions.explanation:
Descartes.

	Cogito Ergo Sum - also commonly translated as "I think, therefore I am", which does not stress the fact that this is part of a debate about the nature of existence.

questions.text: The idea that 'Hell is other people' is an existentialist thought that was dramatized in a play by which philosopher?
The phrase 'deus ex machina' refers to:
questions.correct: Divine rescue in the nick of time
questions.explanation:
Divine rescue in the nick of time.

	It refers to a dramatic device of Greek (and Roman) theatre whereby the gods intervene just in time to prevent disaster. Literally, 'the god from the machine'. (Wouldn't it be nice?)
